description:
At-risk-of-poverty rate

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
63400 EU statistics on income and living conditions

Definition:
Population at risk of poverty / at-risk-of-poverty rate
(after social transfers): Proportion of the population with
an equivalised net income (after social transfers) of less
than 60% of the median of the equivalised net income of the
total population.

Social transfers are paid continuously by the government to
households during the income reference period. Such
transfers include children's allowance, housing allowance
and needs-oriented basic security benefits.


© Statistisches Bundesamt, Wiesbaden 2016
name: At-risk-of-poverty rate
